content: and place the 29 31 33 sts onto your left hand needle p across these sts 74 80 86 sts 3 starting with a k row work in stockinette st for 4 row p across the right side row to create a turning ridge for the hem starting with a p row work in stockinette for 4 row loosely bobble purlwise on the wrong side leaving a long tail with the long tail fold the hem at the turning ridge and stitch down the bobble sts to the inside of the bonnet there will be a small opening at each end of the hem this will be where you feed the bonnet tie through so don t sew it up - edging still using smaller needles with the right side facing and starting in the lower right hand corner of the bonnet pick up and k 4 sts on the hem making sure to only go through the top layer of the hem 1 st for each garter ridge along the bottom of the bonnet and then another 4 sts on the other side of the hem 62 66 70 sts decrease 4 sts over the next row as follows newborn k7 k2tog k13 k2tog 3 times k8 58 sts 3-6 months k7 k2tog k14 k2tog 3 times k8 62 sts 6-12 months k7 k2tog k15 k2tog 3 times k8 66 sts work in garter st for 4 more row bobble loosely tie using smaller needles co 200 210 220 sts using the long tail method k 2 row bobble loosely attach a safety pin to one end of the tie and feed the safety pin through the channel of the bonnet s hem finishing weave in all ends and find a pretty princess to model your creation it is said that princess charlotte wore her bonnet backwards outside the lindo wing she is a trendsetter already this bonnet may be worn either way just flip it around so the hem rests along the chin instead of framing the face - thank you so much for knitting my pattern please contact me with any and all suggestions - 4
